task.title: Setting up a Floating License Server Running as a Standalone Process for OS X, Linux/Unix
task.shortdesc: For platforms other than Windows (such as OS X, Linux/Unix, etc.) the license server is set up as a standalone process using a zip archive installation kit. This installation method can be used for running the license server on any platform where a Java virtual machine can run (OS X, Linux / Unix, etc).

keywords.indexterm: Licenselicense server installed on OS X Linux Unix

p.b: Steps for Installing the Floating License Server as a Standalone Process with a Zip Archive

step.cmd: Ensure that the 32-bit version of Java runtime version 6 or later is installed on the server machine.

info.note:
oXygen License Server uses the following rules to determine which installed version of Java to use:
If you install using the native Windows installer, which installs a version of Java as part of the oXygen License Server installation, the version in the jre subdirectory of the installation directory is used.
Otherwise, if the Windows environment variable JAVA_HOME is set, oXygen License Server uses the Java version pointed to by this variable.
Otherwise, the version of Java that is pointed to by your PATH environment variable is used.

step.cmd: Download the license server installation kit for your platform from the website.
Unzip the installation kit into a new folder.
Start the server using the startup script from a command line.
step.info:
The startup script is called licenseServer.sh for OS X and Unix / Linux and it has the following parameters:
licenseDir - The path of the directory where the license files will be placed. The default value is license.
port - The TCP port number used to communicate with instances. The default value is 12346.

step.cmd: The license key directory must contain a text file called license.txt that contains a single floating license key corresponding to the set of purchased floating licenses.

info.note: If you have more than one floating license key for the same version, or you want to split a set of license keys between two different servers, please contact us at support@oxygenxml.com to merge or split your license keys.
